pROVuf3Gu77bTY53nqS7KA.text: First let's start by saying I'm a Monta fan. I came here seeing it was a new ramen joint, it's definitely spacious inside with a nice ambience. The staff and service was great. The bathroom was clean although they do not have paper towels as an option only air dryer. We got here around 8 and only 1/3 of the restaurant was filled.   I ordered a Tokyo tonkotsu ramen combination with their crispy chicken (3 pieces) and side salad while my girlfriend got a Tokyo tonkotsu ramen as well, both with thin noodles. I added corn for $1 while my girlfriend added chicken dumplings (2 pieces) $2. The side salad was mediocre, if I'd known I woulda just skipped the combination and just got a 5 piece crispy chicken for an extra $1. The crispy chicken was better than most places that I've tried. Now if you think Monta's tonkotsu ramen is salty then this place's broth might be for you as it is not as heavy/thick as Monta's. The chashu was more lean not much flavor, I like a fatty chashu like Monta's. There were not many options on adding your own spice, however the fresh garlic was a nice touch. The thin noodles were different from Monta's but still good.  Over all this has got to be my second favorite ramen place in Vegas, I will probably come back and try a different type of ramen, maybe their spicy chicken.

C57GA4-_wDCyF-4Z0YDI-Q.text: The have a great lunch specials. They really took care of us here. They always make us feel welcomed. I'm glad to go to an Asian restaurant that don't let my glass run empty! Now that we are regulars I feel even more welcomed!! This is an awesome place with great specials all day long! I love recommending my friends and family here!! Thanks for the awesome service!!

photos.caption: Photo of JINYA Ramen Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chachacha for the garlic lovers!!
Photo of JINYA Ramen Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried scallops app from late night chef special very full of garlic
Photo of JINYA Ramen Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kids dessert!!

b6h0URuCZQjL4eotpFZMeg.text: Best ramen I've had in a very long time. I tried it with butter and fresh garlic-amazing! I like the spicy broth but no chicken. Great portions too. It's a must try!

photos.caption: Photo of JINYA Ramen Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Octopus balls...yummy!

MMIzUTTgXHai2Rq2fBXxLw.text: Good ramen.  Service overall was great, ladies were friendly and one seemed super Japanese lol.  Anyways this was the first time I had ramen where the noodles were super thick and chewy. I thought it was pretty good.  I forgot what dishes we ordered so I'll update this later.  Would I recommend this place? Yes  Will it blow your mind? Not sure, but it's pretty tasty  Would I come back? If I'm not hitting buffets in Vegas, definitely.

76D7GrKNA1uGHo3JCT56eA.text: Look out Monta, there's a new kid on the block. Actually, Jinya is quite a few blocks away but it is on par, dare i say better? Having consumed the Tokyo special which includes the standards by which to judge ramen: tonkatsu pork and pork broth, i think better is a consideration.  I found the pork broth to be heavy and filling in the best way. Creamy umami permeates the entire bowl and delivers satisfaction with the perfect amount of salty-ness. Speaking of perfect, i have to mention the temperature of the dish which was, perfect. The only thing worse than cold ramen is losing taste buds right out of the gate!  Add to this slightly aldente noodles and flaky, delightfully seasoned pork and you have a serious contender for Vegas' best ramen. I can't wait to return for more of the small yet exciting menu.  Do be advised that this is a ramen bar so expect a bar-esque music volume, not really my bag thus the four stars but it won't stop me from a return visit.

NsB18eoK5L-H8BWaCHNleg.text: It's a cool, hip, and very tasty ramen place. They play some really funky music and the ambience is stylish. Ramen is top notch. We got there around 12am and got seated right away. Overall, it's a great ramen place that I would definitely come back if I crave ramen again next time I'm in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of JINYA Ramen Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tonkatsu black

XfHisfM_ZImtuO3DNQY5cg.text: I had the vegetable ramen and added some chicken, it was AMAZING! I sat at the little bar are in front of he kitchen watching all the cooks. That was cool. The whole place is a really awesome experience and I will gladly by back for more.

9wNJ1tGC7G4_xZhs7MnXHQ.text: This place really has everything going for it. The atmosphere and music are on point. And the food keeps me coming back.   YOU MUST TRY THE JINYA BUN!! you'll thank me later.  The portions will get you full and are tasty.  The sushi is actually surprisingly good!  The lyceetini is something I would definitely drink again. I actually wish this place had more drink options.

fONaCZca7NPW3ZXSrkRbYQ.text: This is my current favorite ramen restaurant. The employees are friendly and have come to remember us each time we come. They have a fairly wide variety of choices when it comes to ramen which is great because I tend to enjoy thin noodles whereas my fiance likes thick. The sides are also delicious. The steamed buns are light but meaty.   I am sad that their lunch special is gone. It was a wonderful deal for a smaller portion of ramen, rice bowl, gyoza and dessert. It lured me in, got me hooked and jonesing for a ramen fix.

ypVHRcZxmv-xJ9fBwgFEDw.text: The overall experience was awesome. Even though the restaraunt was completely packed, service was still outstanding. Our order was taken once we were sat and the food came out rather fast. Everything from the appetizers to the main course was delicious!

na9H6Z8GXMsZiVyL2BCr4w.text: Awesome late night Ramen. Our server, Igi, greeted us immediately; explained the menu and was patient for any and all questions we had for our first time being there. The wings were amazing & our ramen bowls were massive! I got the JINYA Tonkotsu Black & my boyfriend got the Spicy Chicken. Definitely recommend!

1Sik0R-Pn3J5XO2vZFvotA.text: Cool spot, great food, good music and people. Very different than the usual...and they make Kale delicious!!!

IOdJcKdXjZniZqEf34AZnQ.text: I finally ate here yesterday with some colleagues after driving past the last few weeks. After viewing photos and reviews online, it was easy to know what to order and man was the food delicious.  I ordered the Special: Spicy Miso Based Ramen Combo with Crispy Chicken and Salad. The chicken was perfectly fried and had an authentic Japanese taste. My friend ordered the Gyoza pot stickers and they were perfectly steamed and crisped on the outside. Another member of our party ordered the tempura Brussels sprouts. They were light and crispy all at the same time.  The ramen was very tasty and not too salty like other places. Like most ramen, the meal was filling but Jinya delivered on taste.  The decor in the restaurant was very pleasing and inviting.

jR6gzj4nomrmYteDxd_AOg.text: Always good when i come here. Love the quinoa salad and apps here. Ramen has a huge variety to choose from! Not bad for a franchise.

MSM4QYLH0XxFxU7LU3LhMQ.text: No complaints. We were seated fast, got our drinks super quick, food came fast and was DELICIOUS. I had the spicy chicken ramen and my girlfriend had the tonkotsu black. 10/10 recommend

KKT6o2KotXiRjzYmbLKQhA.text: this is very good ramen.. came here with 3 of my ramen "connoisseurs" there were enough menu options and add-ons to satisfy even them..   their menu has salad, small plates, rice bowls and curry. they got a lot going on.. but the Tonkotsu ramen was pha-nom-in-all   and many toppings at a decent price for your ramen..  location is super convenient too at flamingo and decatur

RDl7bgSsMn2j1u4RtqfY4w.text: Wish I could figure out what the hype is all about at JINYA. Maybe it's for their karagge chicken cause it's definitely not for the ramen. I'm not saying the ramen is bad, but it's not memorable either. It's also very much overpriced for ramen. I would not say that their dishes are authentic. They are more on the fusion side.  Considering price and it's proximity to spring mountain (Chinatown), I'd prefer to make the drive a block down.

55-gfvnGs33Va7EGCDmyug.text: One of the best damn ramen I have ever had! Spicy ramen and the salmon poke & kimchi crispy taco is just Ah-mazing! The ramen is sooo flavorful.

mZ8SfJuYsyF8dPCQcoE-qQ.text: I want to like Jinya, I really do. I came here as it's next to where I get my haircut and was convenient.  Beware there's not a lot of sitting room and lines get long. But I'd say the place is bigger than Monta. I sat at the bar which is also pretty small so beware.  Their menu is to the point which was helpful and does allow options to customize.   My service was ok and nothing stellar as I'm guessing dinner time can get crazy on a weekend.  As far as broth, I found it way too oily and the noodles seemed to thick (which is a personal preference). Because the broth was so oily, you really couldn't taste the freshness of the broth or the meat base of it due to the overpowering flavors.   I'm a proponent of if you have good broth, why over flavor it with other things...your broth should speak for itself and addins I feel are a way to compensate for ok broth.

photos.caption: Photo of JINYA Ramen Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ABhxAZAifzGl4Gf0lbu-QQ.text: BIGGEST RAMEN BOWLS  Before heading out of Vegas, we headed over to Jinya to try their ramen bowls.   Located in an unassuming strip mall with plenty of parking. We were pleasantly greeted, seated right away in a wide open dining area. Although they had a large shared table in the middle of the restaurant, we were seated at 2-top table against one wall.   We started with a generous helping of edamame and the seaweed salad. Both were great.  The ramen bowls are HUGE! Seriously HUGE. Plentiful ramen, overflowing greens, and packed with flavor. You should not leave hungry after eating here!   Come here for an excellent ramen experience.

p2w3LVeTVXYxEfxGX7odnA.text: Their ramen bar is the greatest, I've had ramen in many states but they are no match to jinya. Vegan Creamy Spicy Ramen is my go to, and the happy hour specials are good. They are sticklers in ordering a certain way, so ask prices before hand or they will charge and not negotiate, could just be the night staff. Overall the food is amazing and cooks/atmosphere are upbeat.

photos.caption: Photo of JINYA Ramen Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy Hour

9VLXHDeLXqx2AvNUa3dQIA.text: Surprisingly a very good ramen spot off the strip of Vegas. Located in an unassuming location next to Taco Bell. There were plenty of parking on a Thursday night but we had to wait approx 30 minutes for a group of 3 around 8pm. We arrived after they called us and they sat us in a big community table. It was big enough that we had enough space between us and other people. Limited seating inside, only a few booths and a huge community table.   I tried the Jinya Tonkotsu black, the others in my group had the Sprouting Up Ramen and Tonkotsu spicy. I thought the flavors of my broth tasted much better than the other 2; probably because of the black garlic oil. My noodles were much thinner and was able to soak up the flavors quickly. The noodles were so good! The Sprouting Up ramen had tons of bean sprouts. Before our meal we tried the cripsy chicken as appetizer which came with about 5 pieces. The waiter provided a separate hot sauce which was really spicy. A few drops and your mouth would easily burn; loved it!   Service was attentive and great. We got our foods within less than 10 minutes of ordering. This is definitely comparable to the best ramens we've had in the Bay Area. Would love to come back!

Photo of JINYA Ramen Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8pEtBPsulz03KP1C1FlfMA.text: Came late night with some friends. First time at a Ramen spot and it did not disappoint! Food selection is  great plus you can mix in things you'd like extra on your ramen. Service was very good and server was very friendly. Food was very fresh and tasty! The ramen portion does not seem like it's going to fill you up but....... I was stuffed! Very happy and fed will be coming back!

s7jB7QLjZroJiNzGbbs-0g.text: The vibe was a little weird. Our server started with a big smile and was cheerful, but when I asked questions his demeanor shifted. The rest of the crew was friendly and smiled everytime we interacted. But our server just had a sassy vibe toward the middle of our meal.   The food was ok. It wasnt amazing, and it wasnt terrible. It was - ok. It was filling, but I wasnt hard pressed to devour it like I normally would.   I started this review giving them 2 stars but the personalities of the other workers boosted them to a third star. Not to mention, they had to deal with a large and loud group and still kept their charm.   Try it, see if it's for you... we will gladly drive past next time around. Sorry !

Photo of JINYA Ramen Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork bowl, not bad
Photo of JINYA Ramen Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sald was pretty good. Dressing was interesting.

yKAXvizY5Dl6q0cbIcJbqw.text: Came here after a long night for a much needed warm lunch. There used to be a JINYA in San Diego but it's no longer there - whenever we come to Vegas we tend to always at least visit once.  After finally waking up and getting on our feet to get some food in our stomachs, we got to JINYA around 4pm, which is a pretty odd time - this meant no waiting in line, but I do see that they have the Yelp Waitlist option for busier times of the day.  I was tempted to get something from their Happy Hour list, but I was too tired out that I could only think about getting some Ramen into me.  My favorite dish to get is the Spicy Umami Miso Ramen - I fell in love with this flavor the first time I got it in SD, and was devastated when I found out JINYA would no longer be easily accessible. The broth is really nice and smooth; I might be biased because I do love Miso soup/flavored things. JINYA's noodles are always so bounce-y, which is why I always opt for their thicker noodles because it makes it even more so. Not sure if it's my bad memory, but I do feel like I used to get more toppings - I don't know if they changed their menu or not because it's been a while since my last visit.  There was a slight hiccup while we were paying as a server mixed up our table's orders with another, but it was fixed somewhat fast. Still had to wait a couple minutes before they took back my card which I was confused about since they knew I was ready from the initial payment, they could've just waited for me to take my card back out.

photos.caption: Photo of JINYA Ramen Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy Umami Miso Ramen
Photo of JINYA Ramen Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu (4/5)
Photo of JINYA Ramen Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy Hour Menu

to2-TbYGpjF00oSbiyHj3w.text: TLDR; great ramen place that has a thick soup base.   This is my absolute favorite ramen shop. They used to have one location in San Diego but now the closest one is in Vegas so I always try to come at least once when I'm in the area.   There's a live waitlist through Yelp so we were able to easily gauge what time to leave before it started getting busy. We went a little after the usual lunch hours on Saturday and there wasn't a wait at all.   I ordered the Jinya Tonkotsu Black and made it a combo with a pork chasu bowl. The group also split an order of Takoyaki.   Takoyaki: each order comes with 6 pieces sitting on a bed of egg salad. It's super easy to share this since they stick each ball with a wooden skewer. Can't say if it was the same for all the pieces since I only ate one but I got a good chunk of octopus in my takoyaki. Would recommend this as an appetizer to share!  Pork chasu bowl: the bowl was just alright. The meat pieces were really flavorful but it wasn't as fatty as I would've liked. I've eaten at other restaurants where the meat were also slightly charred and I think that tastes a lot better.   Jinya Tonkotsu Black: my favorite ramen! The bowl itself already comes with garlic oil and garlic chips but I asked for more fresh garlic to add to my bowl. The soup base was nice and thick, rich with all the pork fat. I wish the noodles were a little thicker but it was still good.   If you want good ramen, this is the place to go. I recommend it to everyone and it never disappoints me. I've never tried their other ramens before but I'd imagine they're all also very good.

photos.caption: Photo of JINYA Ramen Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tonkotsu Black
Photo of JINYA Ramen Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Takoyaki
Photo of JINYA Ramen Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork Chasu Bowl

-VfkeITH1vGB0aU3oQU-2A.text: It's almost impossible to find flavorful vegetarian ramen anywhere, so the spicy creamy vegan ramen at JINYA is a rare find with its deep, rich umami flavor and al dente to-die-for thick ramen noodles. My boyfriend had the sprouting up ramen and also noted the noodles' delectable texture. Highly recommend!!  For appetizers we recommend ordering the JINYA pork belly bun and the salmon poke taco. Both were melt-in-your-mouth delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of JINYA Ramen Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon poke tacos *sooooo good!!!!!
Photo of JINYA Ramen Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sprouting up ramen (pork &amp; chicken broth)
Photo of JINYA Ramen Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy cream vegan ramen with added seasoned egg, spicy bean sprouts (smokey flavor), and sweet corn

VND0gANBxlj7wcz7I-3ayQ.text: Food is good but anything else was terrible.  Even though they weren't busy at all, we got to wait about a hour to get the big table/bar where was empty even before we came in. Plus we got to wait another 20 minutes just to get the check. Staffs really need to be trained, working so slow no wonders there's always a long line.

V-QJqiYuZZpeeaQXNVFIdw.text: When I thought I had already found my favorite ramen place, I thought wrong. Jinya ramen bar is probably a step up above almost all ramen bars.   Food: Dad ordered a chicken ramen and he said he liked my creamy vegan ramen better in terms of broth. That's saying something. The vegan ramen here is to die for! Since the spice has fish oil I used the hot sauce on the counter and it was so good. Not a fan of the Hollywood hot sauce but the paste was perfect with the ramen. It was also the perfect amount of food. We got tempura brussel sprouts as well with edamame and they were both done well!   Service: I love the fact that the waiter checks in so often to see if we're doing okay cause parents needed spoons and forks and something of the sort every time. The entire staff says bye to you and its super cute.   Pricing: Total for 3 ramens and apps came out to about $50, totally worth the price considering it's Vegas.  Amazing ramen experience! Try the creamy vegan you won't regret it!

7Gkqh9ODfiMMqDTNgcM_Aw.text: The spicy vegan ramen is to die for  I like to remove the tofu and add broccoli to my bowl.

photos.caption: Photo of JINYA Ramen Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegan ramen without tofu

cTaeH34dOP2NOkddylscrQ.text: OG ramen place in Las Vegas. What is great about this place is that it's open late and the food is consistently good. Is it the best ramen I've ever had ? No. That space in my heart is saved for silver lake ramen. But this will hit every ramen craving spot. I always order the spicy tonkotsu with a ramen seasoned  egg. The egg is cooked to perfection. Complete with the Ooey gooey yolk middle that so many ramen joints get wrong. The soup is always piping hot,  the broth is packed with flavor. The noodles are chewy not sure if they are hand made.   I always order the chicken karage or simply put fried chicken. It's yums as is most everything fried. There's a small salad and dipping sauce on the side to accompany the karage.   Service is fast . Food comes out quick. JINYA is a solid ramen place. I believe in Vegas they have a couple of locations as well as in California.

ocQXYQu0cyfdQ2fh-gCgOg.text: I found out about this place through my co-worker. She said it was so worth the Uber ride, so I went there this afternoon and I was so glad I did.  I ordered mild spicy Tonkotsu(bone broth)ramen, Gyoza(dumpling)and bowl of rice. They have so many different types of ramen here. There were many customers and very busy. I really liked the food. I ordered onsen tamago(soft boiled eggs), but I don't think I will order those again(they were kind of runny), but I will order regular hard boiled eggs next time. They have a la cartel toppings you can order for your ramen as well. Atmosphere was kind of trendy and the they played good music.   Over all, my first visit was a success and I will definitely return next time I'm in Las Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of JINYA Ramen Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gyoza
Photo of JINYA Ramen Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mild spicy Tonkotsu ramen
Photo of JINYA Ramen Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gyoza sauce, seasoning sauce and hot peppers

hJ1aKxUlrTSKJ0pdqn_9eg.text: This has always been my favorite ramen place. The only problem is that the wait is so long. Waited for an hour just to get seated. They've got empty table but they won't let you seat right away even if it's our turn already. I understand that they might be controlling how the food comes out or might be sever shortage but it's not. Not even busy and they're just chilling like there's no wait. The food is good but the service is okay. No sense of urgency.

photos.caption: Photo of JINYA Ramen Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

R1vscIUck5a1jyfsulK1Qw.text: We have always ordered ramen from this place and now we finally tried and sat down to eat inside the restaurant. There's a bit of a line since the place is small and have limited seating. We waited for about 20 mins and got seated. Everybody greeted our group as we come in. After we got seated, our server came to our table and explained the menu to us. You can order appetizers, ramen, or both. I ordered the tonkotsu spicy. It was the bomb. And the great thing is you can order extra noodles if you run out of noodles. I will always recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of JINYA Ramen Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

oN2FoGN0UWKoMevMDAAbVA.text: This was my first experience eating fresh ramen. Much better than the box! I had the meatball special. It was really yummy but also fairly spicy (add advertised). My nose was running and I had broth dripping down my chin and yet I kept eating.

VXOhCBvSYRgESEnlahHMAg.text: Jinya is seriously the best place to go!!!! I love the caramelized cauliflower and their spicy creamy vegan ramen with broccoli! If I could go every single day I would, the best ramen ever

Photo of JINYA Ramen Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy creamy vegan ramen w broccoli

cSldY9TU8s2cyLd0uHsUNQ.text: Great Ramen! Down the street form my office, I have been wanting to try for some time. Finally talked another co-worker to give it a shot and I will be a regular customer! I tried the Tonkostu Black and it was delicious. We got it to go, so can't speak of the servers but the hostess was great, sat us down while we waited and even offered water. May get an extra egg next time....soaks up that broth!!

V9VbrldXLkqPPSLqkOp73A.text: For a small Ramen joint, 3+ servers and 4+ cooks is plenty enough to provide good service.  Our server may have been high I'm assuming because she greeted us with "Wassssuuuup" and spoke very slowly.  But anyways food came out slow and out of order,  Ramen before appetizers, side order curry rice halfway into meal (isn't the curry already made?) and we weren't even done with our food and instead of refilling our empty glasses she asks if we wanted more water.  Hello, we ordered spicy ramen!  The problem was not only they knew their service was slow (they apologized for each dish they brought out slowly), but they continued to be slow.  We waited 25 minutes to get our check.  And the girl at the front of house who's also the cashier didn't know which table to bring my change to.  She can't even do her job right.  I feel bad for whoevers waiting to be seated because the wait wouldn't be that long if they had their ish together. They get 2 stars because the ramen tastes good but there are many in the area with much better service.

pK9YsEfLwwAYq7POGqedzA.text: This place is offers the perfect selection of ramen, appetizers, and rice dishes to choose from.  So far, I've visited approx 8 times and have tried the majority of the menu. All the food is AWESOME! Monta no longer is the only game in town when it comes to delicious ramen. My favs are the Tonkatsu Black Jinya #1, crispy karaage chicken and pork chasu rice bowl. I highly recommend this place. It's the perfect assortment of fine quality food...no overkill...just right.

TbKTh1BnKZjSpEi79oAaUg.text: Best ramen I've ever had in history. Great service, not to expensive, and great food. I came while it was busy so it was a little slow but despite that great all around

R3t-Z7yAh2Ip45qeAdLgew.text: Good food, nice service. Will be coming back. A good place for a cute date night before going to the movies or out dancing and drinking.

0V5j0jin9uYjvkiSKIyeDg.text: This was my first True ramen experience( I have had top ramen but no this place is True ramen as I like to put it) and I am in love only downside for me would be the cost but other than that great service and excellent ramen. I work right up the street and if it didn't cost as much I would eat it for lunch practically everyday. Mmmmmmm goooodd

ANeKWWUGTuaEB-mR_6kMQQ.text: My new favorite Ramen place! I usually go to Monta, but usually end up feeling sick from all the oil. This place has more seating, the staff is on point, and the menu has more to offer. I had the spicy chicken Ramen, the meat was tender and flavorful, and I enjoyed all the elements of the dish. I love that they have combination meals, because let's face it, sometimes noodles are not enough. But with the addition of the gyoza and salad that came with my noodle combination, I left very happy and full! I can't wait to try out their other menu items!

2nRxuWsQp8_w9ae0jOZ3dw.text: Other than the light that kept flicking above our table, this place has a hip and cool atmosphere. I had the Tonkotsu Assari (8.50) and wasn't that impressed. The flavor of the soup base was just ok. For a few more bucks, you can make your meal into a combination. I chose the pork chashu bowl & salad and enjoyed it more than my ramen. Best thing about the meal was their crispy chicken and lychee martini.

vG7XrPFwgH6TKF9qe_qTgQ.text: The ramen is great. The deep fried Brussel Sprouts are wonderful.

B7agJSG6-KQ8XIpVM2ReZw.text: First time here, the waiter was nice and kept coming back to make sure we were doing ok. The food was great! Recommend getting your ramen spicy for an even better flavor.

jXYWmPOPD82rHlq5e8U1gQ.text: The cilantro lime chicken wonton ramen was the only thing keeping me coming back. It was absolutely amazing. Since they removed that from the menu, their other ramen options including their various takes on tonkatsu were just underwhelming in taste. I do like their combo options with the ramen though

O4hjj_wwMvtqagB0MVugYA.text: Great spicy chicken  soup highly recommended. The octopus  balls are a must try. The place can have somewhat of a wait sometimes. Luckily there's a check in list to keep things organized. Great place to come on a date or just to hangout with your friends. Happy Hour has some great deals as well. Their California rolls are decent. I wouldn't recommend the salad though, but it still deserves the 5 stars.

EVp_oG5E1_OSp56ztyXRDw.text: Chef is a jerk. Bad manners. Insists his noodles were perfect when they were terribly underdone. Too bad.

N6Sh7el8b9hvlPl9ysz2-g.text: Jinya is one of the most inconsistent restaurants I have ever been to, which is really unfortunate.  Sometimes the food is absolutely fantastic, while other times the food is bland or too salty.  My GF and I used to go here all the time, however we both decided it wasn't worth the risk anymore...

rjaN54ShPXNarilaPnfUeA.text: We found this place online when we were looking for a new place to eat for Valentine's Day.  We were so glad we gave it a try.  We had to wait a bit for a table for 5 but it was worth the wait!  It was a real nice atmosphere and great service.

B59OI0quEqcdquPHROCv1g.text: Love this place! The vegetable Ramen is delicious. The quantity is enough for my 1 year old and I to split and still have leftovers.

rNyQjxCTeeCboYbBPzR2_g.text: Excellent ramen, love the cha cha cha. Service is great. Only complaint is the waiting area is tiny and the cool tricked out toilet was broken :/

S4HT7wKL9pxOJs3cOUexEA.text: Love love love this place. Sucks that I live in n. Las Vegas cause I want to go here more. Also they ruined "normal" ramen for me. I can't seem to enjoy noodle soup from the grocery store anymore. Ahhhhh. None the less it was amaze, and when I'm down there again I will totally go again.

9938RRuKhDvXbfp48sVC8Q.text: Living in SoCal, one gets used to finding good Asian food.  I've been a fan of Japanese food for a long time, and a *good* ramen place is always a find.  We were trying to chase down someplace for dinner and this place came up.  I wasn't expecting much, but this place was a very pleasant surprise.   I had one of their tonkatsu ramen bowls.  The noodles weren't overcooked, the pork tender,  and the broth was very tasty, while NOT overly salty, which I appreciate.   Worth the trip off the Strip!

GJc0O7HYGH_H__JWrcZjHQ.text: The wonton ramen is delicious. But don't over look any if their scrumptious appetizers either!

sFtElO00SeSoTNa9qFCb3A.text: Best ramen in town! Their spicy chicken ramen is to die for. The service is great and great prices. Definitely recommend it.

P21IegXwRwJjR-nr5p8Fqg.text: Not only is the Ramen spot on, the venue itself very well decorated with a very hip feel -- nice and dim, good music and just an overall great ambiance! I would say it can get a little loud however this is what makes the atmosphere what it is. This will be a stop anytime I am in the area.

krPGHmc0Ug4aqzTeZ0UB8g.text: Amen for Ramen!!! Jinya has been a solid staple in my Las Vegas ramen eating career. They are in a good location and away from the strip and easily accessible. They are also open late until 3am which is also super clutch.  The food here is also super bomb! My personal favorite is the Tonkatsu white or the spicy. The broth is super well spiced and incredibly filling. They also have a pretty good happy hour and appetizers. Cheap bear and squid balls for the win! They also have a vegan ramen that I have never tried but all my vegan friends sing its praises.  The fact that they have a Vegan option is a good sign In my books since I have quite a good amount of Vegan friends. They also have a drive thru that I've never used because I'm not a fan of on the go ramen.   The only downside is that this place is a little small and depending on when you go the lines can get crazy long. Also the women's bathroom is super awesomely decorated, but as of my last visit the men's was just a normal one.   Overall, you definitely should come here if you're needing ramen in vegas

lSw4ZR0yi1FgAxkSpylkcw.text: I just called and placed an order for pick-up. A girl who answered the phone was so rude. She kept talking to somebody while i was telling her what i want. Of course she did not hear me and she kept repeating herself with attitude like i did not understand what she was saying.  It is not just today. I never felt welcoming when i go there. Greeting with smile seems too much work for them. I understand they are busy it is a popular ramen place. But who wants to go back to be treated like that

HygjH5LF6_MIIOTKR8BHew.text: This is, I think, the best ramen place in Vegas.  I may be incorrect, as there are per square mile something like 500% more restaurants in Las Vegas than other standard cities, but for now, this is what I'm sticking to.  The broths are delicious and the noodles are to die for.  Good god, eat it.  Eat it now.

GBb-ttgXyQJeb1P6AOoHxQ.text: I've been in twice, be prepared for a wait, but it's sooo worth the wait! Food has been amazing both times-I got the sprouting up ramen, and I've been craving it since the last time I was there. My boyfriend got the spicy chicken ramen and was also in love. The service is wonderful, everyone is super nice and helpful. Restaurant is clean. Sat at the communal table once, then at a regular booth once. If you have back problems I don't think the chairs at the communal table will work for you, but they may have something else if you have an issue with their stools. Overall, 10/10 would recommend.

74tGcf819_LXwC9DK23D6w.text: My boyfriend and i loves this place we love the food here and really don't mind the wait but today was the final straw of coming back here. We came in today father's day 2019 at 5pm (only me and my boyfriend) only 2 party was waiting in line we were not greeted upon arrival and did not know that we have to sign in to the ipad that apparently is not working. So we've been standing there for the last 15mins only to find out we have to sign in the ipad (we were used to put our names on the paper) the manager helped a customer that just walked in and DISREGARDED WHAT I SAID THAT WE WERE HERE FIRST AND WAS NOT TOLD WE HAVE TO SIGN IN i work in a restaurant and he was rude for not acknowledging any request of the customers then the first people that we're waiting there also said that they could not sign in due to the ipad not working so what gives Manager and employee lacks customer service. We walked out Thank you Jinya

q2GC_YOagXv8S4qTfox4FQ.text: This is one of my favorite ramen spots in Vegas. Many options to choose from and the food is always consistent. The only thing I don't like is the wait. No matter what time or day, if you're dinning in or picking up the wait is at least 30-45 minutes.

K9OwL4kQeyBVlX8JQ-_eaw.text: I've been to a lot of different ramen places with shorter wait times, better prices and service but what keeps me coming back is Jinyas food. There I've tried a lot of there ramens but my all time favorite... the one that I keeps my coming back for more is the Tonkatsu black.. it's so rich and delicious and it makes me so happy and warm when I eat it

KfdmwY__TSlYOL52lxIuBA.text: Decided to try this ramen place that I discovered and loved in Texas.  I was very embarrassed and disappointed during our dining experience because I was telling my girlfriend how good it is. We ordered  Gyoza and asked for a small spoon to stir the Gyoza sauce and was told by our waiter Gino to use our chopsticks instead. First of all, it is unsanitary to use our own chopsticks to stir the sauce container that everyone uses.  After we said that we don't want to do that he said he thought we have not used it.  Its concerning that cleanliness is not a priority for our server.  This is a reflection to the establishment and must be addressed  immediately.   #foodie #foodenthusiast

9oEc06NMYgC-N1JR_FYJoQ.text: Ordered around 12:45am for pickup and was told that it would be a 30 min wait. I just got off work and wasn't in a hurry so I was cool with the wait. I ordered Cha Cha Cha which is for garlic lovers with a chashu bowl and salad and I ordered Tonkatsu Spicy for my boyfriend. The employee who answered the phone asked for my name and number and when I arrived to pickup she had actually called my cell phone. I wasn't expecting that and I don't think any other restaurant has ever done that, but that was actually really nice and convenient to know that they call you when your orders ready.   My bowl tasted so good! It was full of flavor and boy am I a garlic lover! Deeelicious! I thought the soup was lacking quantity because it wasn't covering the noodles and pork chashu completely and I tend to like my soup really.. well soupy!   The chashu pork bowl was good as well and it was just the right size. Not so much to make you full but enough that you'll want more. Salad was ok, I can't put my finger on what the dressing is made from. The Tonkatsu bowl was really good a little kick to it.   All in all really good food. I'll be back! It's a plus that it's right down the street from my boyfriends' place.

iNpDWN9epHy0-lHEqqkoig.text: So amazing. Get the mini tacos. You're welcome. Pretty much a True Asian bistro, and a line out the door always means amazing.

hvh_wZskaw2aP6wd3x5TPQ.text: While visiting Vegas for my birthday I was craving some good ol ramen! Well guess what y'all,this place is popppin! Ordered the chicken broth ramen ,it's served in a huge bowl or Togo bowl which is what we got. Ordered  some  pork pot stickers as well all came out to 30$ not too shabby. Will def go back. They also offer different levels of heat we got the hottest one and it still wasn't hot enough at least to my fiance and I. If you get the mild it'll probably need some extra seasoning . Anyway,I think it's worth it . Also if you go to this particular location,make a reservation because you may wait about 20/30 min

TdmS2bigjP5L906tKnVFwg.text: We waited about 20min but, soon as we got seated and placed our order everything came out quickly and food was really good (I heard good things about this place prior coming and it was still better than expected) if you're vegan, you don't even have to look for anything else try spicy vegan ramen it was so flavorful and satisfying...I didn't think ramen could be so filling. Definitely coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of JINYA Ramen Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yh4s868C8lzhdrD8X_0ziA.text: Ramen joints seem to be a dime a dozen in Vegas. Located outside of Chinatown but on the West side - the place looks like it may have been a fast food joint at one time. Parking was no issue since I arrived before the noon hour. Inside the decor was chic and hip looking with a large island bar located in the middle and surrounded by tables along the walls.  I ordered the Tonkotsu ramen black which contained a large seasoned egg, pork chashu, seaweed and green onion. The broth was tasty and flavorful. Service was solid. I had room for the green tea mochi which is large enough for two but ate the whole dessert. A great way to end lunch.  Overall for being a franchise chain I was impressed with the decor, food and staff here and would return in the future.

Photo of JINYA Ramen Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dining area

AhDc6_2Y-YTvns4RVs8enQ.text: I love Jinya in Houston- literally my favorite ramen bar and the reason for my obsession with the Japanese cuisine. However, this location is sub par.

4wRtOqnrBSLzcw5aYoEfJg.text: Hip for a Ramen place. Nice to see a lot of younger people, in their 20's there. Very cool to see the diversity too. Mexicans, black folks, white folks, different Asians, all slurping away, chopsticks in hand. Hubby and I are ramen fiends so our standard is very high. The flavor was good, not great, not very good. Good. Perhaps the flavor profile was set more for Westerners? I was searching for a teeny weeny detection of a sort of smoky sea flavor. Which is not really discernible, but still exists, in the best tonkatsu broths. Missing complexity I suppose. I wouldn't recommend for ramen fiends like us, but I would for everyone else. Must give them full credit for good service.

2rARn1-Pb_GwA4yRLdQ86g.text: I have been wanting to come here for quite some time per Yelp reviews from friends, however, unfortunately, the service does not live up to the expectation. It took over 30 minutes for us to receive our food. Since we were on our lunch break it ended up costing us the dine-in experience and we had to ask for our food to go.   That is the sole reason for the 2 star review. The food is great. I got the spicy chicken ramen at the HOT spice level and the flavors were on point. I eat fire so it wasn't too hot for me. What surprised me was that I didn't think I'd like the spinach but it was wonderful! The edamame was plain, steamed, hardly any salt. I should have put some garlic on it.   Next time I come I'm going to make sure I have nothing but time. However, this will never be somewhere I stop for lunch again.
